The roots and vines grow rapidly, wrapping around the legs and bodies of those caught, potentially immobilizing them. Creatures in the area when you cast the spell must succeed on a Strength saving throw or become restrained by the entangling plants.
components: V, S

name: Faerie Fire
longDescription: You create a mystical light that outlines creatures or objects within a designated area. This phosphorescent glow makes the affected targets easier to see and hit, providing advantage on attack rolls against them due to the bright outline. The light is a soft, magical glow, often in hues of pink, green, or blue, which does not produce heat or illumination beyond its immediate effect.
components: V, S, M (a small piece of phosphorescent moss or a glowworm)

name: Expeditious Retreat
longDescription: This spell allows you to move at an incredible pace. Upon casting, your movement speed doubles, and you gain the ability to dash as a bonus action on each of your turns until the spell ends. This swiftness can help you escape from danger or reach your destination much faster than normal.
components: V, S

name: False Life
longDescription: You harness the power of necromancy to bolster your vitality, siphoning a semblance of life force from the ethereal plane to fortify your own. As you cast this spell, dark energy swirls around you, and you feel a surge of false vitality, granting you temporary hit points.
components: V, S, M (a small amount of alcohol or distilled spirits)

name: Feather Fall
longDescription: You instantly slow the descent of up to five creatures or objects within range, causing them to drift gently to the ground. This spell prevents damage from falling, regardless of the distance fallen, by reducing their rate of descent to 60 feet per round.
castingTime: 1 reaction, which you take when you or a creature within 60 feet of you falls
components: V, M (a small feather or piece of down)

name: Find Familiar
longDescription: You gain the service of a familiar, a spirit that takes an animal form you choose: bat, cat, crab, frog (toad), hawk, lizard, octopus, owl, poisonous snake, fish (quipper), rat, raven, sea horse, spider, or weasel. Appearing in an unoccupied space within range, the familiar has the statistics of the chosen form, though it is a celestial, fey, or fiend (your choice) instead of a beast.
components: V, S, M (10 gp worth of charcoal, incense, and herbs that must be consumed by fire in a brass brazier)

name: Fire Bolt
longDescription: You hurl a mote of fire from your fingertips at a creature or object within range. On a hit, the target ignites, dealing fire damage. If the target is an object that isn't being worn or carried, it might catch fire.
components: V, S

name: Fog Cloud
longDescription: You create a 20-foot-radius sphere of thick, obscuring fog centered on a point you choose within range. The fog spreads around corners, and its area is heavily obscured. It lasts for the duration or until a wind of moderate or greater speed (at least 10 miles per hour) disperses it.
components: V, S

name: Friends
longDescription: For the duration, you gain the ability to make one creature regard you as a friendly acquaintance. When the spell ends, the creature realizes that you used magic to influence its mood and becomes hostile toward you. A creature prone to violence might attack you, while another might seek retribution in more subtle ways.
components: V, S, M (a small amount of makeup applied to the face of the target as this spell is cast)

name: Goodberry
longDescription: You touch a berry and imbue it with magical energy. For the duration, the berry provides nourishment and minor healing to any creature that consumes it. When you cast this spell, you create up to ten berries, each of which can be eaten by a creature as an action to regain 1 hit point, and the berry also provides enough nourishment to sustain a creature for one day.
components: V, S, M (a sprig of mistletoe)

name: Grease
longDescription: You create a slick, oily layer on the ground at a chosen point within range, making it extremely slippery. Any creature standing on or moving through this area must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or fall prone. Creatures that attempt to stand up within the area must also succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or fall prone again.
components: V, S, M (a bit of pork rind or butter)

name: Guidance
longDescription: You touch one willing creature, granting it a spark of divine insight. For the duration, the creature gains a boost of competence in one ability check of its choice. This spell is often used by clerics to provide aid in tasks requiring skill or knowledge, imbuing the recipient with a sense of divine guidance.
components: V, S

name: Guiding Bolt
longDescription: A flash of light streaks toward a creature of your choice within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes radiant damage, and the next attack roll made against this target before the end of your next turn has advantage thanks to the mystical light clinging to it.
components: V, S

name: Hail of Thorns
longDescription: The next time you hit a creature with a ranged weapon attack before this spell ends, this spell creates a rain of thorns that sprouts from your ranged weapon or ammunition. In addition to the normal effects of the attack, the target of the attack and each
components: V, S, M (a piece of thorn or a small vial of water)

name: Hellish Rebuke
longDescription: You point your finger at a creature that has dealt damage to you, channeling the fires of the Nine Hells through your body. Flames erupt from your fingertip, engulfing the target in a searing blaze of infernal retribution.
castingTime: 1 reaction, which you take when you take damage
components: V, S

name: Hex
longDescription: You place a baleful curse on a creature that you can see within range. Until the spell ends, you deal an extra 1d6 necrotic damage to the target whenever you hit it with an attack. Also, choose one ability score when you cast the spell; the target has disadvantage on ability checks made with that chosen ability. The curse lasts for the duration or until it is removed by a Remove Curse spell or similar magic.
components: V, S, M (a petrified eye of a newt)

name: Heroism
longDescription: You touch a willing creature and imbue it with bravery, granting it the power to withstand fear and harm. For the duration, the target gains temporary hit points and becomes immune to being frightened. Additionally, the target gains advantage on all saving throws against spells and effects that would reduce its hit points to 0.
components: V, S

name: Identify
longDescription: You choose one object that you must touch throughout the casting of the spell. If it is a magic item or some other object that can convey magical properties, you learn its properties and how to use them, whether it requires attunement to use, and how many charges it has, if any. You also learn if any spells are affecting the item or if it has been altered by magic. If the item was created by a spell, you learn which spell created it. If you instead touch a creature throughout the casting, you learn what spells, if any, are currently affecting it.
components: V, S, M (a pearl worth at least 100 gp and an owl feather)

name: Illusory Script
longDescription: You write a message that appears to be innocuous text to all but the intended recipient. The script looks like normal writing to anyone else, but to the one you specify, it reveals the true message. This spell can be used to hide secrets or convey messages in plain sight, making it invaluable for espionage or covert communication.
components: V, S, M (a lead-based ink worth at least 10 gp, which the spell consumes)

name: Inflict Wounds
longDescription: You touch a creature, channeling necrotic energy through your hand to inflict grievous harm. The energy seeks out the life force of the target, causing intense pain and decay.
components: V, S

name: Jump
longDescription: You touch a creature, granting it the ability to leap great distances. The target's jump distance is tripled, allowing them to spring over obstacles or reach high places with ease. This spell enhances the creature's natural agility, making them feel lighter and more buoyant.
components: V, S, M (a grasshopper's leg)

name: Light
longDescription: You touch one object that is no larger than 10 feet in any dimension, and cause it to shed bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet. The light can be colored as you like. Completely covering the object with something opaque blocks the light. If you cast this spell while another casting of it is still active, the previous casting ends.
components: V, M (a firefly or a piece of phosphorescent moss)

name: Longstrider
longDescription: You touch a creature, and its movement becomes swifter and more agile. For the duration, the target's walking speed increases by 10 feet, and it gains the ability to move through difficult terrain without expending extra movement.
components: V, S, M (a pinch of dirt)

name: Mage Armor
longDescription: You touch a willing creature who isn't wearing armor, and a protective magical force surrounds it until the spell ends. The target's base AC becomes 13 + its Dexterity modifier. The spell doesn't affect creatures with natural armor or creatures wearing armor.
components: V, S, M (a piece of cured leather)

name: Mage Hand
longDescription: You conjure a spectral, floating hand at a point you choose within range. The hand lasts for the duration or until you dismiss it as an action. The hand can manipulate objects, open unlocked doors or containers, stow or retrieve items from an open container, or pour the contents out of a vial. It has a strength score of 10 and can carry up to 10 pounds. Additionally, you can use the hand to perform simple tasks like flipping pages or snuffing candles.
components: V, S

name: Mending
longDescription: This spell repairs a single break or tear in an object you touch, such as a broken chain link, two halves of a broken key, a torn cloak, or a leaking wineskin. As long as the break or tear is no larger than 1 foot in any dimension, you mend it, leaving no trace of the former damage. This spell can physically repair magic items but does not restore the magic to such items.
components: V, S, M (two lodestones)

name: Message
longDescription: You point your finger towards a creature within range and whisper a message. The target (and only the target) hears the message and can reply in a whisper that only you can hear. You can cast this spell through solid objects if you are familiar with the target's location, but not through magical silence or areas of magical darkness.
components: V, S, M (a short piece of copper wire)

name: Minor Illusion
longDescription: You create a sound or an image of an object within range that lasts for the duration. The illusion also ends if you dismiss it as an action or cast this spell again. If you create a sound, its volume can range from a whisper to a scream. It can be your voice, someone else's, a lion's roar, a beating of drums, or any other sound you choose. The sound continues unabated throughout the duration, or you can make discrete sounds at different times before the spell ends. If you create an image of an object—such as a chair, muddy footprints, or a small chest—it must be no larger than a 5-foot cube. The image can't create sound, light, smell, or any other sensory effect. Physical interaction with the image reveals it to be an illusion, because things can pass through it. A creature that uses its action to inspect the sound or image can determine that it is an illusion with a successful Intelligence (Investigation) check against your spell save DC. If a creature discerns the illusion for what it is, the illusion becomes faint to the creature.
components: S, M (a bit of fleece)

name: Magic Missile
longDescription: You create three glowing darts of magical force. Each dart hits a creature of your choice that you can see within range. The darts all strike simultaneously, and you can direct them to hit one creature or several.
components: V, S

name: Poison Spray
longDescription: You extend your hand toward a creature you can see within range and project a puff of noxious gas from your palm. The creature must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take 1d12 poison damage.
components: V, S

name: Prestidigitation
longDescription: This spell is a minor magical trick that novice spellcasters use for a variety of simple tasks. You create one of the following magical effects within range: You can instantaneously light or snuff out a candle, torch, or small campfire. You can instantaneously clean or soil an object no larger than 1 cubic foot. You can chill, warm, or flavor up to 1 cubic foot of nonliving material for 1 hour. You can color, clean, or soil an area up to 1 square foot for 1 hour. You can create a nonmagical trinket or an illusory image that can fit in your hand and lasts until the end of your next turn. You can instantly create a small sensory effect, like a puff of wind, a faint musical note, or a brief odor.
components: V, S

name: Produce Flame
longDescription: You create a flickering flame in your hand that sheds bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet. The flame can be used as a light source or hurled at a creature within range as a ranged spell attack. If used to attack, the flame extinguishes upon impact.
components: V, S

name: Protection from Evil and Good
longDescription: You ward a creature from the influence of certain types of creatures. For the duration, the target has advantage on saving throws against spells and abilities used by aberrations, celestials, elementals, fey, fiends, and undead. Additionally, these creatures have disadvantage on attack rolls against the target. The spell ends if the target makes an attack, casts a spell that affects an enemy, or deals damage to another creature.
components: V, S, M (holy water or powdered silver and iron, which the spell consumes)

name: Purify Food and Drink
longDescription: You touch a quantity of food or drink, purifying it of all poisons and diseases. This spell removes any spoilage or contamination, making the substance safe to consume. It does not restore freshness or nutritional value but ensures that the food or drink is no longer harmful.
components: V, S

name: Ray of Frost
longDescription: A frigid beam of blue-white light streaks from your pointing finger to a creature within range. Upon impact, the target feels the chill of the arctic, slowing its movement as frost clings to its body.
components: V, S

name: Ray of Sickness
longDescription: A virulent green ray springs from your pointing finger toward a creature within range. Upon striking, the target must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target becomes poisoned for the duration and takes necrotic damage. On a successful save, the target takes half damage and is not poisoned.
components: V, S

name: Remove Curse
longDescription: At your touch, you attempt to end one curse affecting a creature or object. If the curse is particularly powerful, the spell might not work, but it will at least suppress the curse's effects for the duration. This spell does not remove the curse if it is cast by a creature of significantly higher power or if the curse is integral to the creature's existence (like a lich's phylactery).
components: V, S

name: Resistance
longDescription: You touch one willing creature. Once before the spell ends, the target can roll a d4 and add the number rolled to one saving throw of its choice. It can roll the die before or after making the saving throw. The spell then ends.
components: V, S, M (a miniature cloak)

name: Sacred Flame
longDescription: You channel divine energy to ignite a radiant flame that descends upon a creature you can see within range. The flame does not consume or burn the target but sears it with holy light, bypassing most forms of protection.
components: V, S

name: Sanctuary
longDescription: You imbue a creature with a protective aura that makes it difficult for enemies to harm it. For the duration, any creature that targets the warded creature with an attack or a harmful spell must first make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature must choose a new target or lose the attack or spell. This spell does not protect the warded creature from area effects, such as the explosion of a fireball.
components: V, S, M (a small silver mirror)

name: Shield of Faith
longDescription: You touch a creature and surround it with a shimmering field of divine energy. This protective barrier enhances the creature's defenses, making it harder for foes to land a hit. The energy field glows softly, providing a subtle light in dim conditions.
components: V, S, M (a small parchment with a holy symbol)

name: Searing Smite
longDescription: You brandish the weapon used in the spell's casting and make a melee attack with it against one creature within range. On a hit, the target suffers the weapon's normal damage, and fire engulfs the target. For the duration, the target glows with a fiery aura, shedding bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet. The target must also make a Constitution saving throw at the start of each of its turns. On a failed save, it takes 1d6 fire damage. On a successful save, the spell ends.
components: V, S

name: Shield
longDescription: With a swift gesture, you create an invisible barrier of magical force around yourself. This shield deflects incoming attacks and provides a momentary bulwark against physical harm. The shield snaps into existence just in time to intercept an attack, shimmering slightly with arcane energy.
castingTime: 1 reaction, which you take when you are hit by an attack or targeted by the magic missile spell
components: V, S

name: Shillelagh
longDescription: The caster imbues a wooden club or quarterstaff they are holding with primal magic, transforming it into a mighty weapon. The wood glows with a faint green light, signifying the infusion of nature's strength. For the duration, the weapon's damage becomes magical, and the wielder can use their spellcasting ability instead of Strength for attack and damage rolls.
components: V, S, M (a sprig of mistletoe or a piece of wood from a live tree)

name: Shocking Grasp
longDescription: You touch a creature with a hand wreathed in crackling energy. The power of lightning arcs through the target, disrupting its ability to cast spells and dealing electrical damage. The spell's energy also momentarily disrupts the target's nervous system, potentially causing paralysis.
components: V, S

name: Silent Image
longDescription: You create the image of an object, a creature, or some other visible phenomenon that is no larger than a 15-foot cube. The image appears at a spot within range and lasts for the duration. The image is purely visual; it isn't accompanied by sound, smell, or other sensory effects. You can use your action to cause the image to move to any spot within range. As the image changes location, you can alter its appearance so that its movements appear natural for the image. Physical interaction with the image reveals it to be an illusion, because things can pass through it. A creature that uses its action to inspect the image can determine that it is an illusion with a successful Intelligence (Investigation) check against your spell save DC. If a creature discerns the illusion for what it is, the creature can see through the image, and its other sensory qualities become faint to the creature.
components: V, S, M (a bit of fleece)

name: Sleep
longDescription: You whisper a lullaby, and magical slumber washes over a number of creatures, causing them to fall into a deep, dreamless sleep. The spell affects creatures with the lowest current hit points first, moving to the next lowest if a tie occurs. Creatures that are naturally immune to being charmed or put to sleep are unaffected.
components: V, S, M (a pinch of fine sand, rose petals, or a cricket)

name: Spare the Dying
longDescription: You touch a living creature that has 0 hit points. The creature becomes stable. This spell has no effect on undead or constructs.
components: V, S

name: Speak with Animals
longDescription: You gain the ability to comprehend and communicate with beasts. For the duration, you understand the literal meaning of any spoken language that a beast might use, and beasts can understand your speech. This spell doesn't alter the attitude of the beasts; it merely allows for communication.
components: V, S

name: Thunderwave
longDescription: A wave of thunderous force sweeps out from you. Each creature in a 15-foot cube originating from you must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes thunder damage and is pushed 10 feet away from you. On a successful save, the creature takes half damage and isn't pushed. In addition, unsecured objects that are completely within the area of effect are automatically pushed 10 feet away from you by the spell's effect.
components: V, S

name: Thaumaturgy
longDescription: You manifest a sign of divine power, creating one of several minor magical effects within range. You cause flames to flicker, brighten, dim, or change color for the duration. You can also cause harmless tremors in the ground or create an instantaneous sound that originates from a point of your choice within range, such as a rumble of thunder, the cry of a raven, or ominous whispers. Alternatively, you can alter the appearance of your eyes for 1 minute.
components: V

name: Thorn Whip
longDescription: You create a long, vine-like whip covered in thorns from your hand. With a flick of your wrist, you can lash out at a creature or object within range, pulling it towards you or dealing damage if it resists. The whip can also be used to manipulate objects at a distance.
components: V, S, M (a piece of thorn or a small vine)

name: Thunderous Smite
longDescription: As you channel divine energy, your weapon becomes enveloped in a crackling aura of thunder. On your next successful melee attack, you unleash a booming explosion that can send your foe reeling. The thunderous sound resonates through the air, potentially deafening those nearby.
components: V

name: True Strike
longDescription: You extend your hand and point a finger at a target in range. Your magic grants you a brief insight into the target's defenses. On your next turn, you gain advantage on your first attack roll against the target, as you can see exactly where to strike to make your attack most effective.
components: S

name: Unseen Servant
longDescription: You summon an invisible, mindless, shapeless force that performs simple tasks at your command until the spell ends. The servant springs into existence in an unoccupied space on the ground within range. It has AC 10, 1 hit point, and a Strength of 2, and it can't attack. It can perform simple tasks that a human servant could do, such as fetching things, cleaning, mending, folding clothes, lighting fires, serving food, and pouring wine. Once you give the command, the servant performs it to the best of its ability until it completes the task, then waits for your next command.
components: V, S, M (a piece of string and a bit of wood)

name: Vicious Mockery
longDescription: You unleash a string of insults laced with subtle enchantments at a creature you can see within range. If the target can hear you, it must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or take psychic damage and have disadvantage on the next attack roll it makes before the end of its next turn.
components: V

name: Witch Bolt
longDescription: You unleash a beam of crackling blue energy from your pointing finger, which arcs towards a target of your choice. The energy forms a continuous link between you and the target, allowing you to maintain the assault with additional magical energy if you choose to concentrate.
components: V, S, M (a bit of fur and a rod of amber, crystal, or glass)

name: Wrathful Smite
longDescription: You call upon the divine power of retribution, channeling it into your weapon. Upon striking a foe, your weapon erupts with a burst of vengeful energy, not only dealing physical damage but also instilling a profound fear within the target. The target must confront this fear or suffer from disadvantage on attacks and checks due to the overwhelming dread.
components: V, S

name: Healing Word
longDescription: You call out a word of divine power, and the magic rushes to heal one creature you can see within range. The soothing energy wraps around the target, mending wounds and restoring vitality with a gentle touch of light.
components: V

name: Aid
longDescription: You lend divine strength to your allies, bolstering their endurance and vitality. Each target gains temporary hit points that last for the duration. This spell can be a crucial support in battles, providing a buffer against damage and enhancing the survivability of your companions.
components: V, S, M (a tiny strip of white cloth)

name: Animal Messenger
longDescription: You call forth a tiny beast to serve as your messenger. The creature must be within range and you must specify the location, a distance, and a message no more than 25 words long. The creature travels to the location over the course of the spell's duration, avoiding combat. Upon arrival, it delivers the message to a creature or location you describe, speaking the message in your voice and tone.
components: V, S, M (a morsel of food)

name: Blindness/Deafness
longDescription: You can afflict a creature with either blindness or deafness, impairing its senses. Upon casting, you choose whether the target will be blinded or deafened. The target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or suffer the chosen condition. The spell can be reversed by spells like Lesser Restoration or similar magic.
components: V

name: Augury
longDescription: By casting this spell, you seek guidance from the future, receiving an omen from the divine about the results of a specific course of action within the next 30 minutes. The spell provides a cryptic reply in the form of 'weal', 'woe', 'weal and woe', or 'nothing'. This insight can help guide decisions, though the interpretation remains subject to the caster's wisdom.
components: V, S, M (specially marked sticks, bones, or similar tokens worth at least 25 gp)

name: Calm Emotions
longDescription: You attempt to suppress strong emotions in a group of people, calming them and reducing any hostility or fear. This spell can neutralize effects causing creatures to be charmed or frightened, and it can also suppress any extreme emotions, making it easier to negotiate or prevent conflict.
components: V, S

name: Hold Person
longDescription: You point at a creature you can see within range, and it must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be paralyzed for the duration. The spell can also affect multiple creatures if you target them within range. An affected creature can attempt a new saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.
components: V, S, M (a small, straight piece of iron)

name: Lesser Restoration
longDescription: You touch a creature and can undo a debilitating condition afflicting it. With a gentle touch and a soothing incantation, you channel restorative magic to alleviate one of the following conditions: blinded, deafened, paralyzed, or poisoned.
components: V, S

name: Prayer of Healing
longDescription: You call upon the divine energies of your deity to heal the wounds of your allies. As you chant a sacred prayer, a soothing light envelops your companions, knitting their flesh and restoring their vitality.
components: V, S

name: Silence
longDescription: For the duration, no sound can be created within or pass through a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on a point you choose within range. Any creature or object entirely inside this sphere is immune to thunder damage, and creatures within the sphere can't be heard by creatures outside it, nor can they hear sounds from outside.
components: V, S

name: Spiritual Weapon
longDescription: You create a spectral weapon that floats near you and makes melee attacks against creatures you designate. The weapon can take the form of any melee weapon you choose, shimmering with an ethereal light. When you cast this spell, you can make a melee spell attack against a creature within range. On a hit, the target takes force damage. On subsequent turns, you can use a bonus action to move the weapon up to 20 feet to another spot within range and repeat the attack against the same or a different creature.
components: V, S

name: Warding Bond
longDescription: You form a magical bond with a willing creature within range, sharing your resilience and protection. For the duration, any damage the target takes is split equally between you and the target, and the target gains a +1 bonus to AC and saving throws. Additionally, while the bond is active, you and the target can see each other's status, including health and conditions, regardless of distance.
components: V, S, M (a pair of platinum rings worth at least 50 gp each, which you and the target must wear for the duration)

name: Animate Dead
longDescription: You reach into the realm of death and pull forth the spirits to inhabit the remains of the deceased. With a dark incantation, you cause one corpse within range to rise as an undead creature under your control. This creature follows your verbal commands to the best of its ability, and it will defend itself if attacked.
components: V, S, M (a drop of blood, a piece of flesh, and a pinch of bone dust)

name: Arcane Eye
longDescription: You create an invisible, magical eye within range that hovers in the air for the duration. You mentally receive visual information from the eye, which has normal vision and darkvision out to 30 feet. The eye can look in every direction. As an action, you can move the eye up to 30 feet in any direction. There is no limit to how far away from you the eye can move, but it can't enter another plane of existence. A solid barrier blocks the eye's movement, but the eye can pass through an opening as small as 1 inch in diameter.
components: V, S, M (a bit of bat fur)

name: Aura of Life
longDescription: You create a soothing aura of positive energy around yourself that radiates life and vitality. This aura heals wounds, dispels poisons, and wards against death. Creatures within the aura feel invigorated, and any dying creature within its influence stabilizes immediately.
components: V, S, M (a sprig of fresh mint)

name: Aura of Purity
longDescription: You create a radiant aura around yourself that purifies the air, removes toxins, and wards off disease. This aura provides a sanctuary of cleanliness and health, protecting all within its radius from harmful influences.
components: V, S, M (a sprig of rosemary)

name: Aura of Vitality
longDescription: You emit a soft, glowing aura that pulses with the essence of life. This aura enhances the vitality of all friendly creatures within its range, promoting rapid healing and rejuvenation. The soothing light mends wounds, restores energy, and invigorates the spirit, providing a sanctuary of recovery amidst the chaos of battle.
components: V, S

name: Prayer of Healing
longDescription: You call upon the divine power of your deity to mend wounds and restore vitality. As you utter a sacred prayer, a gentle light emanates from your hands, bathing your allies in a soothing glow that heals their injuries over time.
components: V, S

name: Banishment
longDescription: You attempt to send one creature that you can see within range to another plane of existence. The target must succeed on a Charisma saving throw or be banished. If the target is native to the plane of existence you're on, you banish it to a harmless demiplane. While there, the target is incapacitated. The target remains there until the spell ends, at which point the target reappears in the space it left or in the nearest unoccupied space if that space is occupied. If the target is not native to the plane of existence you're on, the target is sent back to its home plane if it fails the saving throw.
components: V, S, M (an item distasteful to the target)

name: Beacon of Hope
longDescription: You channel divine energy to create a glowing beacon that radiates hope and resilience. All allies within the area of effect feel an overwhelming sense of optimism, bolstering their spirits and enhancing their natural healing processes. The light from the beacon also serves as a guide, illuminating the path and providing comfort in dark times.
components: V, S, M (a small crystal or gem worth at least 50 gp)

name: Blight
longDescription: You invoke the corrupting power of necromancy, causing a virulent energy to infest a creature or plant within range. The energy saps vitality, turning living tissue black and brittle or withering plants to dust. This spell can be particularly devastating against plant creatures or creatures with a strong connection to nature.
components: V, S

name: Bestow Curse
longDescription: You touch a creature, and that creature must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or become cursed for the duration of the spell. The curse can manifest in several ways, chosen by you when you cast the spell. The curse can reduce the target's ability to attack, hinder their movements, or make them more susceptible to damage. The exact effect is determined at casting.
components: V, S

name: Blinding Smite
longDescription: You call upon divine radiance to coat your weapon in a searing light. As you strike, the light erupts in a brilliant flash, potentially blinding your target. Upon hitting a creature with a melee weapon attack, the target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be blinded until the end of your next turn.
components: V

name: Blink
longDescription: With a flicker of concentration, you momentarily shift out of the fabric of reality and reappear in a different location within a short distance. This spell allows you to avoid danger or reposition yourself advantageously in combat or exploration.
components: V, S

name: Call Lightning
longDescription: You summon a storm cloud directly overhead, from which you can call down bolts of lightning to strike your foes. The cloud appears in a space you can see within range and lasts for the duration. When you cast this spell, and then as a bonus action on each of your subsequent turns, you can call down a bolt of lightning.
components: V, S

name: Clairvoyance
longDescription: You create an invisible sensor within range that gives you sight and hearing from its location. You can use this sensor to see and hear as if you were there, gaining insight into areas you cannot physically reach. The sensor can be moved up to 10 feet as a bonus action on your turn.
components: V, S, M (a focus worth at least 100 gp, such as a crystal ball or a silver mirror)

name: Cloud of Daggers
longDescription: You fill the air with spinning daggers in a cube centered on a point you choose within range. These magical daggers fly around, slicing anyone who enters the area or starts their turn within it. The daggers shimmer with a faint, eerie light, making the area look like a deadly dance of steel.
components: V, S, M (a piece of cutlery)

name: Compulsion
longDescription: You exert a magical influence over the actions of others, compelling them to follow a simple command or course of action. The affected creatures must move in a direction or perform an action you specify, provided it is not directly harmful to them. They follow this compulsion for the duration or until they are given a new command.
components: V, S

name: Conjure Animals
longDescription: You summon forth a number of beasts from the natural world to aid you in combat or perform tasks. These creatures appear in unoccupied spaces that you can see within range. They are friendly to you and your companions, and they act on your turn, following your verbal commands. You decide what action each beast will take and where it will move during its next turn, or you can issue a general command such as to attack your enemies or to provide help.
components: V, S

name: Conjure Barrage
longDescription: With a swift incantation, you summon a storm of magical projectiles that rain down upon your foes. These projectiles can take the form of arrows, stones, or even shards of ice, depending on your will, striking all enemies within a designated area with relentless force.
components: V, S, M (a piece of ammunition or a thrown weapon)

name: Counterspell
longDescription: You attempt to interrupt a creature in the process of casting a spell. As you cast this spell, you must see the creature and it must be casting a spell of 3rd level or lower. If it's casting a spell of 4th level or higher, you must make an ability check using your spellcasting ability. The DC equals 10 + the spell's level. On a success, the creature's spell fails and has no effect. If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the interrupted spell has no effect if its level is less than or equal to the level of the spell slot you used.
castingTime: 1 reaction, which you take when you see a creature within 60 feet of you casting a spell
components: S

name: Create Food and Water
longDescription: You bring forth a feast sufficient to sustain up to fifteen humanoids or five steeds for a day. The food is wholesome and nourishing, while the water is clean and fresh, appearing in containers provided by you or conjured by the spell.
components: V, S

name: Crusader's Mantle
longDescription: You call upon divine energy to infuse your allies with holy might. A radiant aura surrounds you and your allies, enhancing their combat abilities with sacred power. For the duration, each affected creature deals additional radiant damage with their weapon attacks.
components: V, S, M (a vial of holy water)

name: Daylight
longDescription: You touch one object that is no larger than 10 feet in any dimension and cause it to shed bright light in a 60-foot radius and dim light for an additional 60 feet. This light is sunlight, which can dispel darkness spells of 3rd level or lower.
components: V, S

name: Dispel Magic
longDescription: You attempt to end one spell on a target or in an area. Choose one creature, object, or magical effect within range. Any spell of 3rd level or lower on the target ends. For each spell of 4th level or higher on the target, make an ability check using your spellcasting ability. The DC equals 10 + the spell's level. On a successful check, the spell ends.
components: V, S

name: Elemental Weapon
longDescription: You touch a nonmagical weapon, imbuing it with the power of an elemental force. For the duration, the weapon becomes magical, if it wasn't already, and gains a +1 bonus to attack rolls. Additionally, you choose one of the following damage types: fire, cold, lightning, or acid. Attacks with the weapon deal an extra 1d4 damage of the chosen type.
components: V, S

name: Fear
longDescription: You project a phantasmal image of a creature's deepest fears into its mind, causing it to become frightened. The affected creature must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or drop whatever it is holding and become frightened for the duration. While frightened by this spell, a creature must take the Dash action and move away from you by the safest available route on each of its turns, unless there is nowhere to move. If the creature ends its turn in a location where it doesn't have line of sight to you, it can make a Wisdom saving throw. On a successful save, the spell ends for that creature.
components: V, S, M (a bit of fur from a black cat)

name: Feign Death
longDescription: You touch a willing creature and put it into a death-like state, making it appear as if it has died. The creature is unable to move or react, its body becomes rigid, and its breathing, heartbeat, and warmth become undetectable. This state can be used to deceive observers or avoid detection by creatures that detect life. The creature can still hear but cannot see or feel anything.
components: V, S, M (a pinch of graveyard dirt)

name: Fly
longDescription: You touch a willing creature, granting it the ability to fly. The creature gains a flying speed of 60 feet for the duration. When the spell ends, if the creature is still aloft, it descends at 60 feet per round until it lands safely.
components: V, S, M (a wing feather from any bird)

name: Gaseous Form
longDescription: You transform yourself or another willing creature you touch into a cloud of mist. The target gains the ability to fly at a speed of 10 feet and can hover. It can pass through small cracks and openings, but cannot manipulate objects or attack. The target's equipment melds into the gaseous form, making it weightless and unable to be interacted with. The transformed creature is immune to nonmagical damage and has resistance to damage from magical weapons.
components: V, S, M (a bit of gauze and a wisp of smoke)

name: Haste
longDescription: You touch a creature, dramatically speeding up its movements and actions. The target gains an additional action on each of its turns, which can be used only to take the Attack (one weapon attack only), Dash, Disengage, Hide, or Use an Object action. Additionally, the target's speed is doubled, it gains a +2 bonus to AC, it has advantage on Dexterity saving throws, and it can't be targeted by opportunity attacks. When the spell ends, the target can't move or take actions until after its next turn as the rapid pace catches up with it.
components: V, S, M (a shaving of licorice root)

name: Hypnotic Pattern
longDescription: You create a twisting pattern of colors that weaves through the air inside a 30-foot cube within range. The pattern appears for a moment and vanishes, but it leaves behind an entrancing visual display that captivates creatures' minds. Each creature in the area who sees the pattern must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or become charmed for the duration. While charmed by this spell, the creature is incapacitated and has a speed of 0. The spell ends for an affected creature if it takes any damage or if someone else uses an action to shake the creature out of its stupor.
components: S, M (a glowing stick of incense or a crystal vial filled with phosphorescent material)

name: Lightning Arrow
longDescription: You channel the power of the storm into your arrow or bolt, transforming it into a projectile of pure lightning. When fired, the arrow streaks through the air, leaving a trail of electric energy. Upon hitting its target, it explodes in a burst of lightning, potentially affecting nearby foes.
components: V, S, M (a piece of flint and a feather)

name: Magic Circle
longDescription: You create a 10-foot-radius, 20-foot-tall cylinder of magical energy centered on a point on the ground that you can see within range. Glowing runes appear wherever the cylinder intersects with the floor or other surface. The circle can be used to contain, protect against, or summon creatures, depending on how it is attuned. When you cast this spell, choose one of the following effects:
components: V, S, M (holy water or powdered silver and iron worth at least 100 gp, which the spell consumes)

name: Major Image
longDescription: You create the image of an object, a creature, or some other visible phenomenon that is no larger than a 20-foot cube. The image appears at a spot that you can see within range and lasts for the duration. It seems completely real, including sounds, smells, and temperature appropriate to the thing depicted. You can use your action to cause the image to move to any other spot within range. As the image changes location, you can alter its appearance so that its movements appear natural for the image. Physical interaction with the image reveals it to be an illusion, because things can pass through it. A creature that uses its action to inspect the image can determine that it is an illusion with a successful Intelligence (Investigation) check against your spell save DC. If a creature discerns the illusion for what it is, the creature can see through the image, and its other sensory effects become faint to the creature.
components: V, S, M (a bit of fleece)

name: Mass Healing Word
longDescription: You call upon the divine power of healing, uttering a sacred word that resonates with restorative energy. This energy spreads out, touching the wounded souls of your allies, mending their injuries with a soothing light.
components: V

name: Alter Self
longDescription: You assume a different form. When you cast this spell, you can change your appearance or gain physical adaptations. You can alter your appearance to look like any creature of the same basic arrangement of limbs that you might choose, but your size and basic physical form remain the same. Alternatively, you can choose to gain one of the following adaptations: aquatic adaptation (you can breathe underwater and gain a swimming speed equal to your walking speed), or natural weapons (you grow claws, fangs, spines, or horns, which are considered magical weapons for the purpose of overcoming resistance).
components: V, S

name: Arcane Lock
longDescription: You touch a closed door, window, gate, chest, or other entryway, and it becomes magically locked. The spell creates an invisible, magical lock that can only be opened with a specific verbal command or by the caster. The lock is as strong as mundane locks but cannot be picked or forced open by normal means. When someone attempts to open it without the command, they feel a magical resistance.
components: V, S, M (gold dust worth at least 25 gp, which the spell consumes)

name: Barkskin
longDescription: You touch a willing creature, and its skin hardens and takes on a rough, bark-like texture. This transformation grants the creature a natural armor, enhancing its resilience against physical harm.
components: V, S, M (a piece of bark)

name: Nondetection
longDescription: For the duration, you hide the target from divination magic. The target can't be detected by any divination spells or sensors, nor can it be perceived through magical scrying sensors. This spell grants the target a shield against magical prying, ensuring privacy and secrecy.
components: V, S, M (a pinch of diamond dust worth 25 gp, which the spell consumes)

name: Meld into Stone
longDescription: You step into a stone object or surface large enough to accommodate your body, melding yourself and your gear into the stone. While melded, you are in a state of suspended animation and are protected from the outside world. You can see and hear as if you were standing where you entered the stone, but you can't move or take actions. The spell ends if you choose to end it (no action required) or if the stone is destroyed or moved.
components: V, S

name: Phantom Steed
longDescription: You summon a large, ethereal horse made of swirling mist and spectral energy. This steed is semi-transparent, with eyes that glow softly. It can carry you or another willing creature across the land at a swift pace, leaving no tracks. The steed has the appearance of your choice, from a majestic warhorse to a sleek, otherworldly creature, but it remains non-combatant, focusing solely on transportation.
components: V, S

name: Plant Growth
longDescription: You cause plants within the area to become thick and overgrown. The plants entangle creatures and enhance the natural growth of vegetation. Overgrown areas can impede movement, while crops and other plants grow to maturity instantly.
components: V, S

name: Protection from Energy
longDescription: You touch a creature and imbue it with resistance to one damage type of your choice: acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder. For the duration, the target has resistance to the chosen damage type.
components: V, S

name: Revivify
longDescription: You touch a creature that has died in the last minute, restoring life to its body. The creature returns to life with 1 hit point. This spell can't return to life a creature that has died of old age, nor can it restore any missing body parts.
components: V, S, M (diamonds worth at least 300 gp, which the spell consumes)

name: Sending
longDescription: You send a short message of twenty-five words or less to a creature with which you are familiar. The creature hears the message in your voice and can reply in a like manner immediately. The spell allows communication across any distance, even across planar boundaries, but if the target is on a different plane, there is a 5% chance that the message doesn't arrive.
components: V, S, M (a short piece of fine copper wire)

name: Sleet Storm
longDescription: You conjure a storm of sleet that hurls down in a 40-foot-radius cylinder, centered on a point you choose within range. The area becomes difficult terrain, and visibility is reduced to 5 feet. Creatures within the area must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or fall prone. Additionally, the storm extinguishes exposed flames in its area and turns any non-magical fire into smoldering embers.
components: V, S, M (a pinch of dust and a few drops of water)

name: Slow
longDescription: You alter time around up to six creatures of your choice in a 40-foot cube within range. An affected target's speed is halved, it takes a -2 penalty to AC and Dexterity saving throws, and it can't use reactions. On its turn, it can use either an action or a bonus action, but not both. Regardless of the creature's abilities or magic items, it can't make more than one melee or ranged attack during its turn.
components: V, S, M (a drop of molasses)

name: Speak with Dead
longDescription: You grant the semblance of life and intelligence to a corpse of your choice within range, allowing it to answer several questions you pose. The corpse must still have a mouth and can't be undead. The spirit within the corpse uses the knowledge it had in life, provided that the corpse isn't older than 10 days. The spell fails if the corpse was the target of this spell within the last 10 days.
components: V, S, M (a bit of bone and a drop of blood)

name: Speak with Plants
longDescription: You imbue yourself with the ability to communicate with plants. Over the duration, you can understand and speak with plants, which can provide you with information about creatures that have passed, the condition of the earth, or secrets hidden in the forest. Plants can respond in a language you understand, though their knowledge is limited to their surroundings.
components: V, S

name: Spirit Guardians
longDescription: You call forth spirits to protect you. They flit around you to a certain radius, where they manifest as semi-transparent figures that wail and shriek. These spirits lash out at hostile creatures within their area, attempting to repel them or cause harm.
components: V, S, M (a holy symbol)

name: Stinking Cloud
longDescription: You create a 20-foot-radius sphere of yellow, nauseating vapors centered on a point you choose within range. The cloud lingers in the air, spreading around corners, and is heavily obscured. Each creature that is completely within the cloud at the start of its turn must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or become poisoned until it leaves the area. A creature that succeeds on the saving throw is immune to this spell's effects for 1 minute.
components: V, S, M (a rotten egg or several skunk cabbage leaves)

name: Confusion
longDescription: You unleash a chaotic energy that muddles the minds of your enemies, causing them to act unpredictably. Affected creatures might attack allies, wander aimlessly, or simply stand confused.
components: V, S, M (a pinch of powdered owl feathers)

name: Conjure Minor Elementals
longDescription: You summon up to four minor elementals from another plane of existence. These elementals appear in unoccupied spaces that you can see within range. They are friendly to you and your companions for the duration. Roll initiative for the summoned creatures, which have their own turns. They obey any verbal commands that you issue to them (no action required by you). If you don't issue any commands, they defend themselves from hostile creatures but otherwise take no actions.
components: V, S, M (a bit of earth, air, fire, and water)

name: Control Water
longDescription: You command the waters within your reach, manipulating them to serve your will. You can choose to either part the waters, redirect their flow, or create a whirlpool. When parting water, you create a path through water up to 20 feet wide and 100 feet long. Redirecting flow allows you to change the course of a river or stream up to 50 feet in any direction. Creating a whirlpool forms a 30-foot radius of turbulent water that can trap creatures within.
components: V, S, M (a drop of water and a pinch of dust)

name: Conjure Woodland Beings
longDescription: With a whisper to the spirits of the forest, you summon forth woodland creatures to aid you. These beings appear in unoccupied spaces that you can see within range, and they are friendly to you and your companions. They act on your turn, following your verbal commands. If you don't issue any commands, they defend themselves but otherwise take no actions. The creatures remain for the duration or until they are reduced to 0 hit points.
components: V, S, M (one holly berry per creature)

name: Death Ward
longDescription: You touch a creature and grant it a protective ward that shields it from death. For the duration, if the target would be reduced to 0 hit points, it is instead reduced to 1 hit point. Additionally, the first time the target would take necrotic damage, that damage is negated and the spell ends.
components: V, S

name: Tongues
longDescription: This spell grants the creature you touch the ability to understand and speak any language it hears. For the duration, the target comprehends and can communicate in any language, spoken or written, that it encounters. This does not allow the target to understand magical symbols or glyphs, but it does facilitate communication across linguistic barriers.
components: V, M (a small clay model of a ziggurat)

name: Beast Sense
longDescription: You touch a willing beast and forge a sensory link with it, allowing you to see through its eyes and hear what it hears. For the duration, you gain the senses of the beast, including any special senses like darkvision or keen smell, but you are deaf and blind to your own surroundings.
components: S, M (a bit of fur from a bloodhound)

name: Blur
longDescription: Your body becomes blurred, shifting and wavering to all who can see you. For the duration, any creature has disadvantage on attack rolls against you. An attacker is immune to this effect if it doesn't rely on sight, is unable to see, or can see through illusions.
components: V

name: Branding Smite
longDescription: As you strike with your weapon, you channel divine energy to sear your target with a luminous brand, marking them with a glowing symbol that sears into their flesh. This mark not only deals additional damage but also reveals the target if they attempt to hide or become invisible.
components: V

name: Cordon Of Arrows
longDescription: You create a magical barrier of spectral arrows that hover in a protective ring around you. As enemies approach, the arrows launch automatically to strike at them, providing a defensive measure against incoming threats.
components: V, S, M (a single arrow or crossbow bolt)

name: Crown of Madness
longDescription: You place a magical crown upon the head of a humanoid within range. The crown is invisible, but the target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or become charmed by you for the duration. While charmed, you have a telepathic link with the target as long as the two of you are on the same plane of existence. You can use this telepathic link to issue commands to the creature, which it does its best to obey. If the target is commanded to take an action that would obviously result in harm to itself, it can make another Wisdom saving throw to resist that command. The spell ends if you or your companions do anything harmful to the target.
components: V, S

name: Darkness
longDescription: You create an area of magical darkness that emanates from a point you choose within range. This darkness is impenetrable by normal light, including even light from magical sources of 2nd level or lower. Creatures with darkvision cannot see through this darkness, but creatures that do not rely on sight are unaffected.
components: V, M (bat fur and a drop of pitch or coal dust)

name: Lay on Hands
longDescription: You channel divine energy through your touch to heal the wounds of a creature. As you lay your hands on the injured, a warm, radiant light emanates from your palms, mending flesh and soothing pain. This spell is particularly potent in the heat of battle, providing immediate relief to fallen allies.
components: V, S

name: Bless
longDescription: You call upon divine favor to bolster your allies, granting them resilience and courage. As you cast this spell, a faint, shimmering light envelops the chosen warriors, enhancing their combat prowess with a touch of divine inspiration.
components: V, S, M (a sprinkle of holy water)

name: Aura of Protection
longDescription: You invoke a powerful protective aura that surrounds you and extends to your allies, creating a shimmering barrier of golden light that deflects harm and bolsters defenses. The aura radiates from you, providing a sanctuary against physical and magical threats.
components: V, S, M (a small silver mirror)
